intro: Calathea monstera, commonly known as the Swiss cheese plant, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive pattern of light and dark green veins. The plant's foliage is often marked by a variegated appearance, with some varieties displaying striking white or silver markings. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish. Due to its unique leaf structure, it is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant.
